title: Fast approximate Bayesian inference of HIV indicators using PCA adaptive Gauss-Hermite quadrature
summary: This paper introduces Naomi, a spatial evidence synthesis model for producing district-level HIV epidemic indicators in sub-Saharan Africa. It jointly models multiple policy outcomes using both household survey data and routinely reported health system data, providing a tool for countries to generate estimates.
usefulness_reason: Score 90 assigned because the paper explicitly mentions a "spatial evidence synthesis model" and uses "household survey data" and "routinely reported health system data" to produce "district-level HIV epidemic indicators". This directly addresses "Spatio Temporal" and "Survey data", and the district-level indicators can be considered a form of "Contextual dataset".
